website_summaries.verdict: Ooma one-ups cable company internet phone plans with better call quality and a basic calling plan that starts at free (before taxes).
pros: The Ooma Telo is affordable hardware that delivers basic landline-like service without monthly fees, with few compromises
cons: Calls and basic service is toll-free, but you still need to pay a few bucks a month in local taxes
Wi-Fi support requires you to buy an additional dongle

website_summaries.verdict: Ooma offers attractive, functional home VoIP hardware, an excellent mobile app, economical pricing, and good call quality.
pros: Free calls after device purchase (taxes not included)
Excellent device with built-in speaker and control buttons
cons: A lot of standard features require a Premier account

customer_reviews.title: $9.99 for activation and no warranty when purchased from Amazon???
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today from Amazon, tried to activate and got a message that I needed to call Ooma to activate. Called and spoke to a rep who then asked me where I purchased the unit, I told her from Amazon, and she informed me it would be an additional $9.99 to activate the unit for use, and that there would be no warranty. She then stated that if I didn't want the pay the fee, and get a full warranty, I could return the unit to Amazon and buy another elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: HgTstr

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to cancel service
customer_reviews.text: Pros - The service is easy to setup and activate. Cons - It is impossible to remove your credit card billing data from the account via the web without having to call the service personally. This is a very unfortunate requirement because it means they will charge your card if you are unable to contact them for whatever reason, indefinitely. Cannot recommend such a poor policy which they claim is for security. The top shopping and internet bank sites do not have such a policy, so why does Ooma?
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Slick setup, cannot cancel or change service
customer_reviews.text: Physically, technically this is a great product. Setup could not be easier, just a few clicks and plugs and your making calls. Voice quality was good, features (for premium) is really nice. The issue come when you want to cancel your service. Ooma will not answer the 'billing dept' phone, literally ever (I sat on speakerphone 2 hours jamming the hold music). I think its a critical part of signing up for a service like this, support. So far Ooma is an epic fail on that side. So let the buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Jamison K Utter

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Cancel Service!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I would have left this review while we were using the Ooma service I definitely would have given it five stars. The service was terrific. However, we no longer used it and cancelled it. Ooma continues to charge our card every month for the last three months despite our canceling. This probably won’t be an issue for those who plan on using this forever. But the inability to terminate service is inexcusable.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent charges on my card since 08/2015
customer_reviews.text: I had a friend from work who talked me into it. However, the service was very unreliable sometimes world sometimes didn't. I canceled my subscription sinc 08/2015 have called multiple times spoke with the supervisors (always India or Philippines who don't understand US laws) they still are charging me monthly even when I haven't used it for over 6 months. I finally had to file a dispute through my bank and get a new card all together which is a pain to update everywhere is needed. Definitely don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marielena

customer_reviews.title: Was initially happy with the product until I started getting some telemarketer ...
customer_reviews.text: Was initially happy with the product until I started getting some telemarketer calls that were international. So I went to the personal blacklist to add the numbers, but the calls kept coming in. Contacted OOMA and they told me that the blacklist or call blocking if you will, can not block international calls. What a totally useless feature. AT&T call block could. I currently have my phone line disconnected due to this and I guess I will be canceling my OOMA Premium account.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Hill

customer_reviews.title: You have to cancel your credit card to get them to stop billing for discontinued service
customer_reviews.text: You have to cancel your credit card to get them to stop billing for discontinued service. $4.70 @ month forever or until you cancel credit card they charge. Indian or Filipino phone room is like talking to a bowling ball.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Overcharges and drops calls frequently
customer_reviews.text: Worse decision I ever made is when I ported my Spectrum phone to Ooma. First, Ooma will bill you 39.99 which is approx 47.xx when they tell you they will bill you $20.00 Spectrum router will not allow phone directly into router so I had to use Cat 5 (Plan B on set up sheet). Lastly, calls drop while you're talking and this has yet to been figured out. Do yourself a favor and negotiate your landline. At the very minimum, own your own router. This has been a nightmare. Billing/CS is a waste of your time.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable VOIP call quality
customer_reviews.text: Product was highly recommended by my friends, but didnt work well at all for me. Replaced the wireless router and cables, upgraded internet to 100 Mbps with no improvements to quality of the VOIP service. Setup a DMZ, but this did not help either. Very poor support from Ooma and they really should be putting a disclaimer upfront that internet "JITTER" should be 5 ms or less for good call quality. Call quality was miserable with noticeable delay in the voice, garbled voice transmission, other party unable to hear at times etc
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: The device works fine for what it was designed to do
customer_reviews.text: The device works fine for what it was designed to do. My reason for 1 star is for the year it took for Ooma to cancel my service when I decided to keep my landline. Despite repeatedly being told it was canceled, charge from them would show up again a month or two later. All the while the unit was in a box in the basement, not hooked up. Took having bank change credit card number.
customer_reviews.author: S. Furniture

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. They state that it will block telemarketers with the premium service; but every day I receive about four telemarketers calls only listing a city name and state even though I have selected to block all anonymous calls. Called Ooma customer service to no avail. Supposedly I was elevated to their upper level technical support but did not change or help the problem. Had Spectrum Time Warner with no-mo-robo calls that worked flawlessly. Thought I would save some money with Ooma. I guess you get what you pay for even though it isn't necessary cheap. Now, I'm regretting the move.
customer_reviews.author: K. Parson

customer_reviews.title: It's like trying to terminate a gym membership
customer_reviews.text: Beware- should your situation change and you try to cancel your account, it is extremely difficult to do so. When I was finally able to cancel my account, and with $0.00 balance due, I continued to receive aggressive and unethical emails to the likes of "If you do not call us immediately, your account will be turned over to collections" (paraphrasing but content is accurate.) At this point, I DID call to confirm that my account had been cancelled, only to continue to receive these aggressive emails stating that my account was ***Delinquent***. I will not be considering OOMA in the future. It's like trying to terminate a gym membership, but worse.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Ilk

customer_reviews.title: Its a scam, device works well but after confirming ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a scam, device works well but after confirming to shut account, they still charge you every month and instead of helping you they only interested in asking you to reconsider to open an account.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Terrible service from Ooma.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible service from Ooma. For over 2 months, several chat and phone sessions I was never able to make outgoing calls from ported number. Online chat said they would send replacement unit, phone said no. Switched back to Vonage and it was working in 3 days. Now I have to file a claim with my credit card company against Ooma for services charged and not delivered, and for Ooma device.
customer_reviews.author: ECS

customer_reviews.title: horrible support and horrible product
customer_reviews.text: horrible support and horrible product. I have never been able to use it. I contacted ooma for support with not luck not one person has been able to help. Red button flashing. I have followed all the steps the rep told me to do and none of them know what to do. I am just out of luck. Too late to return through amazon. I just blew my hard earned money
customer_reviews.author: MyHonestReviews

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, calling support is useless
customer_reviews.text: This is a follow up review. Initially I was happy with my Ooma but it soon became unreliable. It seems to always handle incoming calls (main reason we got it was to keep our old landline number alive) but frequently loses the ability to dial out. I get a dialtone, dial the number, then hear a bunch of clicks and get dialtone again. I have tried working with support but between their poor understandng of English (what part of "can't make calls" don't you understand?) and lack of any ability to fix anything it's a waste of my time. Power cycling the Ooma multiple times eventually fixes the problem - until the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Happy RV'er

customer_reviews.title: The worst experience ever
customer_reviews.text: The company will not cancel your subscription!!! I called them more than 10 times to cancel my subscription from last year 11/17. They just dont do anything and continue to charge your card every month. I had to call my bank to block the merchandise to stop the charges. This system is not free !!! And after you give them your card number, good luck to cancel the subscription. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Jamileh

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one it replaced, except...
customer_reviews.text: ...the activation was terrible! After 10 years (almost to the day) of using my old Ooma Telo, it finally crapped out. No problem, I thought, it served me well of 24/7 service for a decade - I will just buy another one. The unit arrived FAST and I thought all I had to do was punch in the activation code into my online account. Oh no....after spending 20 minutes trying to figure out online activation, I finally caved and called their 800 number. It took 4 transfers and another 30 minutes to get them to activate it. They had no explanation why there was no online activation. Since activation, it's been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schmuckatelli

customer_reviews.title: Just like some cable companies, you must call to discontinue service - then comes the hard sell! Avoid!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ooma is every bit as bad as the cable company. It is SO easy to start and oh so difficult to end. To begin service everything is handled online. To disconnect service you must waste your time calling them, waiting for the next available "service" person then attempt to convince them you really do want to discontinue service. They try their hardest to convince you to continue the service. I had no other choice but to get ugly with the representative to actually disconnect my service. Never again! My Ooma box is going straight to electronics recycling. I wouldn't wish this POS on anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Guitared

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with my landline phone . . .
customer_reviews.text: The $4/mo phone bill rates 5 stars, but many times when my Ooma Telo updates itself, the landline phone that's connected to it per owner's manual instructions becomes inoperative. Makes me wonder if only the landline phone that Ooma tries to sell with the Telo works properly together all the time (including update periods)? Long story short, I keep re-booting the Telo (un-plug / then re-plug it in) with fingers crossed that my phone service will return. My brother has been using a competitor's less-expensive product, Google's OBI, longer and without hitches. Time to switch?
customer_reviews.author: Glory2God!

customer_reviews.title: Glad we made the switch to ooma
customer_reviews.text: We cut cable and phone from our provider. I wanted to keep a home line and found the ooma option. It works perfectly. I paid the extra amount to have my original number switched over. They said it could take up to 2 weeks but it was complete in 3 days. Great sound quality, easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Marie McClellan

customer_reviews.title: They keep charging your credit card even when you call and disconnect
customer_reviews.text: This company is complete malpractice. Never ever give them your credit cards. I disconnected my account in December 2019 and they kept charging my credit card till July 2020. When I noticed this charge I called them. They initially told me they will refund for 2 months only. Later their supervisor agreed to refund but only for 4 months and not since January 2020. Never ever get service from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Prashant Prakash

customer_reviews.title: Very bad call quality and extra costs and fees.
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a year now. Quality of call has been very bad from the start. I contacted Ooma many times but it never improved. I have 10mps speed and expected better. I finally bought an Obihai to use with Google Voice and the quality is 10 times better for free. Now I have been trying to port out my Ooma number and encountering all kinds of trouble. Be very careful with Ooma. Customer service is very pleasant but ultimately useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Better and cheaper than Telco phone service.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use it with both house wired and cordless phones. Porting phone numbers was easy and fast. Good customer service. Saves about $300/year versus Telco or Cable voice service. Just like having Telco voice service, but better and more reliable. Of course, you must have good reliable wired Internet service in the house. Very good audio quality. Works OK with fax. I can get notification of voicemails on my Ooma smartphone app. Can view call activity log on web browser or smartphone app; can pick up voicemails from PC or smartphone. Highly recommended. The major downside is that if house AC power is out, Ooma phone service does not work, but that's what cell phones are for.
customer_reviews.author: rdc

customer_reviews.title: Good sound. love it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Ooma device for a couple months, the sound quality is great, sounds just as good as the telephone company. Very easy to set up, if you need help, customer support is great, people are very friendly and knowledgeable. I decided to get premium service to keep blocking telemarketers. No more calls, finally I have a device that doesn't make me want to throw it out the window!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Ooma as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my landline with the Ooma, which was easy to set up, plug in, and use. My first bill has already been charged to my credit card. Less than $6.00. The Ooma has better sound quality and the voice recorder is easier to operate than what I had. The other plus is I changed my phone number (didn't have to) and to this point the telemarketers haven't been able to find me. I'm so glad I switched to Ooma.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Nomorobo integration missing
customer_reviews.text: Ooma device provides clear incoming and outgoing voice quality. Voice mail feature good. Ooma Premier service (extra $10/month) claims to provide robocall blocking through Nomorobo integration but have not been able to get it to work. Product guide, video guidance, and call to support unhelpful. Nomorobo, whose online test said it does not support my phone number, advises to enable Nomorobo in Ooma Premier but Ooma user guide screens and customer service could not explain how to do this. When using Nomorobo with a previous phone service (Vonage), phone would ring only once, indicating that Nomorobo intercepted the robocall. Never have gotten any single-rings in a month of using Ooma Premier.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer127

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Any internet phone is only as good as the connection speed. Purchased this in 2014 and have had no trouble with it. As long as internet service is available the Ooma service is there. It has had the same $4.95 a month fee the whole time. Interfaces to my Panasonic wireless phone system, so I can connect multiple handsets. Cell phones connect via blutooth to the panasonic. You need your cell service to call cable provider when the internet is out. Obviously ooma is not available without internet connection. Phone talk quality is on a par with wired connection. When I switched in 2014 I saved $35 a month.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES E PARE

customer_reviews.title: "Alexa, call 911!"
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Ooma to use with the Echo Connect so that I could make 911 calls using Alexa. I have Echo devices all over the house, in the garage and in the barn, so as long as I'm within voice range, I can summon help in an instant. The basic service is free, plus taxes, which comes to about $4 a month in Nebraska. This is WAY cheaper than landline service, which I think is around $40 or 50 per month. They have a premium service for an extra $10 per month that gets you things like a second phone line and call blocking, but I don't make or recieve calls often enough to make it worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Packrat

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: When Cox Cable moved me to a voip system I decided to look at other options. A friend recommended Ooma, and after some additional research, I purchased the Ooma. Installation was simple although it took a bit of time for the system to fully boot and update (20 minutes?). I opted for the advanced features as it included porting my old land line number. Have not yet used all of the features, but I like what I have used so far. A big savings over Cox and features and voice quality are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: FES

customer_reviews.title: Robo Call Hell
customer_reviews.text: I used to recommend OOMA with no hesitation. I have had it for ten years without any issues, including using it for my business. As of today, I can no longer recommend it due to the excessive amount of robo calls received via OOMA. In the past, we would get a few, especially during campaign season. Now I receive 10-12 calls per day, all robo. I shouldn't have to pay for OOMA premiere to avoid getting blasted with these calls non-stop. They start at 7:30 and continue until well past 9:30 pm. it's insane. What a shame because they have a solution, they just want to charge you for it
customer_reviews.author: Shoprgyrl

customer_reviews.title: Good device, even better VoIP service
customer_reviews.text: Ooma is fantastic, have saved a lot of money over the years with them. The Tele Free has functioned flawlessly for us for years. had one go bad after more than two years but the insurance paid for a free replacement unit - thank you Square Trade. Suspect that a power spike killed the original unit so now have this one on a UPS with surge suppression. Device connects quickly and reliably. Phone calls with Ooma are not disconnected and connections are clean at least 99.9% of the time. Love the Basic Service, no need to pay more than $5/month for VoIP!!
customer_reviews.author: Biz-EE

customer_reviews.title: Buy it from OOMA and get a product that works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 4 year old version whose speaker failed. The product from Amazon did not come in OOMA packaging just a plain white box. It did not work. It was either a refurbished model since the firmware was out of date or a very old version they had on the shelf. I contacted OOMA and their support team over-nighted a replacement and that worked out of the box. Thanks OOMA. This isn't the first time that I've gotten old none working products from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ooma user

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous VOIP Technology
customer_reviews.text: I’d used Ooma via Vivint for five years and when Vivint went out of the Internet business, I was so happy with Ooma that I bought a machine to continue the service. It works flawlessly. Porting my number was simple. One thing that I hadn’t counted on, was being able to use it while traveling. I plug it into any Internet port and have my home phone with me. It runs 14 telephone extensions in my home. The blacklist is such a great tool as it’s ability to block numbers rids my life of robo callers.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieDay

customer_reviews.title: Would give 5 if more transparent
customer_reviews.text: If you live in area without 911 location by cell, this solves that problem. I just hooked it up. My only "compliant" is the lack of transparency about cost. It's not "free." Must pay taxes, which for me are $5.07/mo. There is a link that allegedly gives you your tax amount. Mine was incorrect. Also, I ported my number. Fee quoted was $39.99. It ended up costing $46.22. Not cool. Taxes and "universal regulatory fees." I called and they couldn't explain. It's not a lot of money. It's just the principle of the matter, especially after dealing with "gotcha" tactics of former landline company!!
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzmom

customer_reviews.title: on paper is fine, the real world is not
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a fine product/service... But to get ANY support is close to a nightmare... Calls are dropped all the time... incoming, outgoing, doesn't matter. Looking for a replacement ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Vismara

customer_reviews.title: Great phone service, far cheaper than AT&T or Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to eliminate paying Comcast $20/month plus $3-4 in taxes for phone service. Now costs something like $3-4 a month in taxes. It works very well, better than the old Comcast phone service - which when my comcast voicemail inbox filled up (once every 3-4 months) they provided no warning but just stopped recording phone messages. Four stars rather than 5 because it occasionally requires rebooting - I'm guessing but I think probably about once every 3 months the lights just start flashing, I just pull the power cable out and put it back and everything works. With respect to comparisons to other phone service reliability it's probably about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Wooster

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My dad bought one in 2009, that he gave to me and it went bad in June 2020. It started throwing out interference that I can hear on the radio in 2015, and then it burned out. The old one, I had to write a bunch of VOIP rules on the firewall to prioritize packets. But on this one, it worked fine without the rules. It even has full duplex support, you can talk and listen at the same time. Big upgrade for me, and the original price was $199 back in 2009.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kirker

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple setup. I didn't really need a new phone number, so I ported (extra cost) my current number which only took a few days. Needed to call tech support and they were helpful with setting up personalized voicemail greeting (documentation could be better). Great alternative to landline.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality. Needs an UPS.
customer_reviews.text: Set it up for my mother-in-law. She seems to like it. I did have to buy a battery backup (uninterruptible power supply) so that the phone and the cable modem keep working through power glitches. The unit takes a very long time to boot up from a power cycle. You might think something is wrong, but be patient and it will eventually come alive, indicated by the steady blue light. Sound quality is very good. Overall happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Connected

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous one for four years when it started to blink blue and started dropping calls all the time, so I replaced it with this one, but I had the same problem with this one, after going around and around with OOMA support, I called ATT and told them I wanted my router-modem replaced, and they did so, after I called them twice, problem fixed. OOMA support never told me to call them, even after I suggested it, they need to be a little more pro active.
customer_reviews.author: macktheknife

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price, easy set up, works with your existing phone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Dropped our cable,phone,Internet pkg due to constant price hikes. Bought the ooma system, works great, sounds great, very easy to set up. Best of all, it works with our existing phones. Monthly bill for taxes and fees is a whopping $6.60 per month. Hard to go wrong here. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Been very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little upset with this product at first as it seemed to drop calls often and have trouble staying connected. But I finally figured out I had a bad ethernet cable, and once I replaced it it has worked like a charm. Can't believe how much money this has saved me over the past year I've had it. $75 for this purchase and only about $5 a month for fees. My phone bill with ATT used to be about $60/mo so it has paid for itself after 2 months. Phone quality has been great and have had no issues since I replaced the cable.
customer_reviews.author: chichitao

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for better!
customer_reviews.text: The Ooma device has been an absolute godsend for me. I work from home, using the phone to connect with customers. The clarity of the calls is so much better than even the landline I used to have. The ability to have a phone number in another area code means my customers don't need to call me long distance and I don't need to have an 800 number. The price initially is a little steep but over time I will definitely be saving money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from RecipesNow!

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my defective unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because the Ooma telo unit I had been using 10 years was failing, preventing calling in or out until being reset. I saw this one on sale and purchased and eventually replaced the old unit. Instructions for replacement were lacking, but after calling tech support (easy and quick) I found that I could have just called them first and activated the unit, transferring the phone number all at the same time. It would have taken minutes and avoided other steps I had taken. Just hook it up, call tech support, give them the information (label) and it will be ready to use with your same phone number. Easy!
customer_reviews.author: T Fowl

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Vonage, hello Ooma!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It was so worth the money. I have the premier package which makes my monthly bill 15.00 plus tax which is not bad at all. I haven't had to call customer care or tech support so I won't toot their horn. All in all great product, great call quality.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Time to save some money
customer_reviews.text: The experience I had with customer support was good. The tech was able to resolve a serious feedback problem as I was just about ready to send it back. Setup was easy but I didn't like being prodded to buy accessories I didn't want. Like virus support. Almost lost a star because of it. It makes an easy setup somewhat involved. I will update when the porting process is over.
customer_reviews.author: Idouglas99

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to exercise patience if you cancel your service.
customer_reviews.text: Beware! If you use one of the Ooma paid services it works great up until the time you want to cancel it. They really don't want you to cancel and it took me about fifteen minutes of saying to the operator (on the phone of course) "I just want you to cancel my service" to finally get them to agree to do it. Products like this that allow you to sign up online, should also allow you to cancel on-line.
customer_reviews.author: Super Cub Guy

customer_reviews.title: I guess it is a case of 'you get what you pay for'. But I am disappointed as I had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time user of VOIP phone carriers at 15 or so years. Prior to Ooma I used AT&T as well as Vonage. I would say that while the price from Ooma is fantastic the voice quality is far below the level of either Vonage or AT&T. I guess it is a case of 'you get what you pay for'. But I am disappointed as I had high hopes
customer_reviews.author: Foxdown

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and works as expected, however limited in phone number selection and automatically getting calls from another township and telemarketers. The only way to stop this is to pay for their $9.99 "Premiere Service" which should be part of the basic plan.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: A little over $5 a month
customer_reviews.text: I have the original, I set this one up for a customer. Easy install, I did pay the $40 to port the existing number, took almost two weeks. Only issue was DND (Do Not Disturb) was somehow enabled. Sound quality is very good. For a single line standard plan a little over $5 a month is very nice & I know you can fax if you need to. I set it up to use the Panasonic base for voicemail.
customer_reviews.author: btc909

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Software included allows me to block repeat unsolicited SPAM callers, and the community of users contributes a database of numbers called from that Ooma blocks automatically. Has reduced unsolicited calls greatly. Call clarity is great. I had my number ported over, and that was without incident. I have lost power due to a storm since installing the Ooma, and that does pose a problem in that it is a VOIP phone, so without power, the system does not work. But for the price, I have decided that I can deal with the loss of this phone during a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Look da rice

customer_reviews.title: Fails Repeatedly: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had to purchase this because the original Telo failed after about 18 months, obviously not under 1-year warranty. I am writing this in April, 2017 and this device has now failed. While Ooma has has attractive business model, the hardware is apparently not well designed and/or manufactured. Support is provided only overseas, making it difficult to access. Since this one is still under warranty (purchased late May of 2016), it is going to be replaced, but it is frustrating to have to go through this near-annual ritual of reactivating, setting up voicemail, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: Home Phone: Went from $50/mo to $5/mo
customer_reviews.text: So the headline is reason enough to switch, but in addition to the price decrease, you also get easy setup and optional (extra nominal fee) features not even offered by traditional phone company. Perfect sound, easy setup, and in addition, I bought the extra whole house internet filtering, which is customizable and can be overridden with a password. The whole house internet filter helps when you have teens and tweens and don't want to go find separate software for multiple device types and install filters on up to 7-8 devices and maintain those licenses for that software. Plus there is no way a teen can disable this. Did I mention the easy setup?
customer_reviews.author: teresa toth

customer_reviews.title: Lower Phone Cost with Ooma
customer_reviews.text: I have had an Ooma system for several years. My original unit started giving me problems, so ordered another unit. New unit is a little bit smaller than original. Was really easy to install and get it activated. Phone number stayed the same. Really happy with Ooma service. I do not use any of the premium Ooma services, nor their handset. Was happy to stop my AT&T service. Ooma monthly bill has increased over the last 5 years from $3.82 to $5.91.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: When I see the $6.00 monthly phone bill (taxes, etc) I smile knowing the $30 monthly bill I paid the phone company is history. This is an upgraded unit from the old 2012 unit I had. I really like the feature that send me an email when I have a voicemail. That it can also connect with my cellphone is great but I decided not to use it.
customer_reviews.author: PeterCW

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to anyone as long as they have done their homework and know this is the route they want to take!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I was very hesitant due to the price point but I recently became a cable cutter and as little as we use the home phone it is still necessary to have. So I decided to spend the money and give it a shot. I will say, it was easy to install and get working. My bill has been exactly what they said it was going to be and I have noticed no problems with the my VOIP phone service. I would recommend this product and service for someone looking for a good alternative for a phone service at a price that is affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT new as described, USED/already activated.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't activate the Telo with the code supplied because the "NEW" unit had already been activated and assigned to a phone number (that wasn't mine) in Colorado -- (720) 432-3604. I got that number by plugging the telo in and calling my cellphone. Ooma support could not assign the telo to my account/number, and said that all I could do is return it. I will return it, and buy it from another source. I was greatly inconvenienced and am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary in Southern California

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Our landline phone and undependable 4-wire DSL were via Frontier. After switching ISPs, we bought the Telo to replace the landline. Installation was easy and trouble free. It took a few weeks to port over the home number, mostly because Frontier screwed up and wouldn't release it initially. Works great, sound quality is good, with plenty of setup options. Ooma offered a free trial of their premium service, but I don't see any need for now. Since the line is hooked up to a local answer machine, I set the Telo pick-up to a lot of rings to keep it missed calls recorded locally.
customer_reviews.author: JayBird1944

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Ooma
customer_reviews.text: Just a horrible experience from start to finish. Ooma employees lying to me about my port status. Claiming there is no response from fios after days. Then when I ask to cancel my account and stop the port, they tell me it will take 3-5 days and cannot be certain that my number wont get ported in the interim and the number lost.
customer_reviews.author: GT Man

customer_reviews.title: Great to end the spam and robocalls
customer_reviews.text: When we had AT&T, we were getting at least 10 spam calls a day and concluded that we were pretty much paying $50 a month to be harassed by Telemarketers. We switched to Ooma, for $10 a month plus about $7 in taxes mainly for the feature that lets you use community-based screening to block spam and robo-calls. When one does get through, simply log onto Ooma's web site and report it. It's blocked for you from that point on. Once enough people report the same number, it's blocked for everyone who selects call blocking. Now we get maybe two spam or robo calls a WEEK. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Ruzicka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my vacation home in Scottsdale, AZ
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I am SO happy to DUMP my old phone service with COX! It sounds great and so far has been very reliable. I have no complaints about its function. One note: The supplied ethernet cable is very, very cheap and mine had an intermittent connection that caused problems. It took a few days to troubleshoot, but once I swapped it out with a better quality cable everything was great. I would not use the supplied ethernet cable if you buy one of these units.
customer_reviews.author: SKalata

customer_reviews.title: love Ooma saves me money
customer_reviews.text: i have had Ooma since 2012 and have saved almost $3000. so when my Telo died after 7 years i had no issue with buying another unit. setup was really quick with the help of the amazing costumer service. i can't say enough how happy i have been over the years with the quality of the voice clarity and service. love the wifi adapter it save the clutter of wires without lose of voice clarity.
customer_reviews.author: brian podolak

customer_reviews.title: Kind of does what it is said to do
customer_reviews.text: Voices seem a bit tinney to me. Sometimes the incoming voices even begin to sound like Charlie Brown's teacher. I have plenty of DSL bandwidth, so that's not the issue. I will try an alternate wifi/router configuration (Option A) to see if that helps. If not, I will pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: RAT

customer_reviews.title: Terrific sound, reliability and marketing caller blocking
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Cheap, but pay the $10 for premium then block undesirable callers. You can block by area codes or just exchanges you don’t get calls from and that ended my annoying callers cheaply! Clear sounding calls, haven’t had an outage that I know of in the year of service. Note the WiFi connection sucked very badly and I plugged it directly into my router.
customer_reviews.author: Void

customer_reviews.title: They just want to rip as much money of you as possible
customer_reviews.text: Have been Ooma customer for more than 3 years. The service was OK at this low monthly fee. It disconnects and can't answer phone call sometimes. I changed my name recently, and I wanted to change my outgoing call Id to match my name. I can't change it in their online system. It asked me to call their customer service to change it, but the online system didn't mention about fee for changing it at all. When I called them, they said I need to pay $19.99 just to change the outgoing caller id. That's ridiculously expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: VOIP with free phone number and calling Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Talk about the wow factor. I was up and running in 12 minutes. No problems at all. Phone sounds great. Going through all the features that are now available to me and here it comes again WOW. I am impressed, and it integrates with my google voice number. If you are looking at voip this is the one to get. Small monthly fees (government taxes) Mine less than 5.00. But I am going to get the premier service after the trial period is up. I had chatted with their website service several times and they were very patient with me and all my questions . So their customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry E Irvin

customer_reviews.title: horrible product, which is the only reason I am taking the time to write my first review.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first review I have written here, only because the product and customer service was horrible. I had called twice when I could not get the ooma to work at all. The red light would blink and the phone had a constant busy signal. The online customer service told me to reboot it, and to call back the next day when the reboot didn't work. The live customer service told me to reboot it. That's all they could do. Then they fought with me another 10 minutes when I wanted to cancel my service that was less than 24 hours old because the phone line never worked. I decided to keep my working landline instead after this disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy and pretty too
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Ooma to get rid of my costly landline with Comcast. I wanted to port my current number so I set up a temporary number with Ooma. I sent the necessary information to Ooma to port the number over and they had it done in a few days. It works beautifully. The sound is great, the service is excellent and Ooma has a great web site to set up your account. I am kicking myself in the backside for not having done it sooner. And the Ooma device is pretty enough to be a decoration on your living room table. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jerbear

customer_reviews.title: Be advised to Stay with what you have
customer_reviews.text: I regret that the Ooma didn't work for me. I was planning to cut cable, but of course you must have Wi-Fi to use Ooma. The Ooma was a nightmare. I really can not think of anything good to say about Ooma except they have a very talented staff. Of course the cable company was anything but helpful in making the change over. I lost my phone number for some time but finally got it back. It was a total waste of time and money, neither of which can be recovered.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive pricing
customer_reviews.text: Deceptive pricing as you get to pay monthly taxes - $5.71 in US - and it is not at all clear when you buy the product. Setup is also bad as they require a credit card and they have you opt-in on expensive up sell services that you probably do not need. Very poor voice quality when combined with an Alexa speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Costas

customer_reviews.title: EASY as EASY
customer_reviews.text: Switching from Verizon landline to Ooma. So much easier than MajicJack which I had to return defective. With Ooma, Simply register online, follow the 4 step directions - BE PATIENT - let the system boot up RED, RED blinking, Purple, REboot - wait a few minutes and give it time to do what it needs to do. That's it. Had my neighbor call me on my new # when the light turned solid blue - BETTER than FIOS landline - and I used to work there! THANK YOU OOMA!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Chihuahua

customer_reviews.title: Great Telephone Service
customer_reviews.text: We had lost control of our landline and this device is putting us back in control. We subscribed to the optional Ooma service and can now block any and all numbers. We still get calls from new numbers, but once they call and don’t leave a message - I block them forever. Some caller even called me using my own number as a caller ID so I blocked my number too - don’t think I’d ever need to call myself anyway.
customer_reviews.author: D Pettigrew

customer_reviews.title: Can't even tell it's a VoIP service
customer_reviews.text: This device had saved me a lot of money compared to the pricing of internet providers and traditional phone lines. It has already paid for itself many times over while saving me hundreds over the years. Got this as a replacement for my original. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F.

customer_reviews.title: works as described
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. This thing absolutely replaces my land line service and I don't even think about it. It just works. Setup took 15 minutes, and since then, no problems. My 85.00/month ATT bill has been replaced by a 4.73 cent tax only bill. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: gitpicker

customer_reviews.title: It works - and way cheaper than Verizon
customer_reviews.text: I got annoyed with the Verizon bill, and decided time to move. I got this ooma, tried it for a month, then ported my home phone over to it. I don;t use the phoen a lot, but when I do it works fine. Sound quality is good and I hava had no problems. Quick to install and config. I have had littled exposure to support (just the porting) and that has gone OK.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Have used this Phone Service from Ooma close to a ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this Phone Service from Ooma close to a year. It works ok except when receiving a call from a cell phone. Then the call breaks up and there are high pitched noises. I have contacted Ooma and all I get is yes, there can be interference from cell phone calls. I am going to cancel my Ooma account as most of our calls come in fro cell phones.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Pay up front for the device, pay low monthly cost later
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap voip option that's free from google. 1. Pay an up front price for the voip device. 2. Opt out of ooma premier. 3. Then pay only federal universal service charges, state and local taxes, fees & surcharges and regulatory and compliance fees are billed monthly and are subject to change (for me that's about $5 a month). The audio quality is great, and i can call any where in the US without issue (unlike magicjack where you can't call most rural locations, alaska, or hawaii).
customer_reviews.author: shamil

customer_reviews.title: Works Reliably
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my fax machine linked to an all-in-one printer come fax machine. Never missed a fax. Works wonderfully. Next I will get the line and get my phone line on it too. I dont think there is any other more reliable product out there. I paid to port my number on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rashida Furniturewalla

customer_reviews.title: I love my Ooma Telo and am saving a bundle while not being tethered to my cell phone.
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't followed the "trend" towards abandoning land lines for just using cell phones, you should really consider getting an Ooma Telo. I have a dedicated land line VOIP phone, with unlimited calling in North America for about $5 a month. The call quality is excellent. I've never had a dropped call. 911 service is available and you can port your old number over if you choose. Setup is a breeze and customer service is excellent. I love my Telo and am saving a bundle while not being tethered to my cell phone. If you'd like a land line phone this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Free Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Ooma owner since 2011... just bought the new unit
customer_reviews.text: Well the old Ooma Telo finally died after 8 years of working flawlessly. The original unit cost about $200 and the new ones are less than half that price. I probably don't need this except for family that still uses our former land line phone number. I ported that over to Ooma when I dropped AT&T. The new unit arrived and because I was switching my old Ooma service to the new unit I called customer service to activate it. In less than 15 minutes the unit was up and running and back in business. Couldn't have been easier.
customer_reviews.author: Pete in PG

customer_reviews.title: Ooma Telo VoIP Free Home Phone Service is the Best.
customer_reviews.text: We have cell phones but we like the features of a VoIP for our daily contacts that we don't want to give our cell phone numbers. The voices are very clear and are extremely happy with the service. It's a very inexpensive alternative. Check it out, you won't be sorry. We had this service for over 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: D.A.

customer_reviews.title: Ooma is friggin Aweome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually went through the trouble of adding on a line to my cell phone plan and when i called my dad to let him know, he said, "No you should look at Ooma!"....looked them up and its exactly what we needed!!! i called and canceled the phone i had just ordered LOL And waited for my prime shipping. 2 days later i couldn't be happier. We now have a house phone for my son when he gets home from school. Ooma Telo is awesome! Easy to install and works immediately. I highly recommend Ooma. And with 4,000+ reviews great reviews its totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Tech support not all that good
customer_reviews.text: After a great amount of difficulty trying to work with people on the phone (at last after about 4 phone calls and working with my son got things working). After that phone working fine. I must admit I was stupid and kept paying the 1.90 a month for months before got things all set up correctly. Probably just tech illiterate, but the people I talked with did not seem much better. I did someone to talk to fairly easy though. I almost threw the thing away, but glad I did not. As stated after set up correctly things going fine.
customer_reviews.author: gary winter

customer_reviews.title: high failure rate
customer_reviews.text: Although I have been an Ooma customer for over ten years, I cannot recommend this unit. This is the third unit I have obtained in the past two years, purchased for a relative, and it lasted 9 months before the speaker died. Both other units lasted less than a year, the first replaced by Ooma under warranty and the next covered by my CC extended warranty. The overall service with Ooma is fine, and I have a unit in my house that must be close to 10 years old and functions fine, but now I have to argue with Asurion to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: LMNTRY

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Omar for years and I’m very happy with the service. My only issue is you have to call them to switch out a old unit to the new unit. However, the exchange only took 30 minutes after my support call.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Third unit.
customer_reviews.text: Can't be all bad if I keep buying them. Usually last a bit over a year. This one is probably two years old now. Either my luck is improving or the product is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't we do this sooner?!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this. After years and years of paying for a landline we now have cut that cord. Set up is so easy and it worked! Sound quality is good and the base unit operates like an old school answering machine to review voice mails so there is no dialing to check voice mails. So far this has been great!
customer_reviews.author: QandAguy

customer_reviews.title: No more RoBo Calls!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding 😃 No more robo calls! I love the voicemail on my phone app. And in top of that I am saving over $50 a month over AT&T hard wire phone service. Did I say no more robo calls. Call quality is very good, almost as good as a wired phone (when it was not buzzing due to poor connections in the boxes along the road). I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: finding happy

customer_reviews.title: I really like Ooma. The price is really right at 15
customer_reviews.text: I really like Ooma. The price is really right at 15.00/month for expanded service. That's a savings of $95.00 a month versus ATT!. My mom was hesitant to change.....took a year to convince her. But when she did the savings was right there especially since her granddaughters paid for the device and the porting of her old number. We even noticed the robocalls were waaayyyyy down. Go Ooma!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than landline.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in two days plugged into modem,plugged in phone and it came up. Transferred my number . Unplugged ATT connected house phone line and it works great. My security system uses it with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: louise craft

customer_reviews.title: Save some money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my daughter to help cut down on the amount she had been spending with another carrier. It's working perfectly! I've had an Ooma system myself for about 5 years and have been extremely happy with the function, the quality of the voice projected, the dashboard options, and, of course, the major financial savings!
customer_reviews.author: Corina J Walker

customer_reviews.title: OK, When it works. Customer Service not good.
customer_reviews.text: OK When it works... Bought this and 1 year and 1 month later it died. Bought another and ONE MONTH later IT DIED. The "customer service" granted me a ONE TIME replacement in the form of a Remanufactured unit. Will not buy again. Very disappointed in company.
customer_reviews.author: James Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed, I like the item.
customer_reviews.text: Crystal clear phone conversations. Easy to set up and designate phone number. If you're going to port your number to this equipment I would strongly suggest purchasing the prime package and the 39.95 porting fee is free. It also gives you another number that you can have dual numbers and provides extra benefits for less than 10 dols a month. I've moved away from Magic Jack since they don't provide caller ID identification only the phone number display.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Love my Ooma Telo!
customer_reviews.text: My old 2014 model Ooma Telo finally died so I didn't hesitate to buy the latest model. Customer service was EXCELLENT in helping me to replace my old base with a new one. Transfer was seamless and everything works exactly the same as it has for 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ken W.

customer_reviews.title: Winner NOW FAIL
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly out of the box. Line is dead quiet just like the pin drop commercials. Using on a dsl setup Century link modem/router C1000A and an ATT CL2909 phone. Setup,activation and voicemail could not be easier. I live in the mountains in Colorado, so I was skeptical. Is nice to be proven wrong sometimes! I CLOSED MY ACCOUNT 3 MONTHS AGO AND MY CREDIT CARD IS STILL BEING BILLED FOR STATE TAX. BEWARE OF THESE IMBECILES!
customer_reviews.author: Pooch

customer_reviews.title: The product I got would not allow me to activate ...
customer_reviews.text: The product I got would not allow me to activate it because it was a used product. It had already been used, but sold as minor imperfection. reOoma tried to get me to pay more to allow me to reactivate it. Not the deal proposed on Amazon. Run, don't walk away. Everybody wants there money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Derek D. Muehrcke

customer_reviews.title: Convoluted International calling and terrible support practices
customer_reviews.text: Bought Ooma to replace my calling plan and planned on making international calls. After working with their support for 4 weeks, they told me I have to get a premier plan. Their twitter account says I have to get an international plan. Their website says I dont need that and I can just prepay an amount ( which I did) . Still couldn't call internationally and wasted my money on this device. Hoping they are going to give my money back. Also, their support is really bad. Everytime you call, you would have to explain everything all over again and do the same troubleshooting. Going to Ooma has been a big regret.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Awful sound quality/customer service
customer_reviews.text: My phone would only work half of the time and if it worked it was extremely static. I did cancel the service and it was one of the worst Consumer service experiences I ever had to go through. They will only expect cancellations via phone were they connect you with a "Service Representative Spezialist" that puts you in a high presser sales Environment for 15 minutes. You want to cancele and they try to sell you stuff and won't take no for an answer, seriously!
customer_reviews.author: TOFJ

customer_reviews.title: It is Ooma.  It works well!
customer_reviews.text: It is Ooma. It works well! Downside? It replaces an identical box that died after just less than 2 years of service. Still a savings over traditional land lines, but disappointing service life. To do a replacement, you MUST CALL OOMA BEFORE YOU PLUG IT IN!!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Gault

product_meta.title: Ooma Telo VoIP Free Home Phone Service. Affordable Internet-based landline replacement. Unlimited nationwide calling. Low international rates. Answering machine. Option to block Robocalls
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe smartest home phone is the one that gives you exactly what you want with the greatest savings. That's Ooma Telo. Connect Ooma Telo to your high-speed Internet and regular home phone and get crystal-clear nationwide calling for free. You pay only monthly applicable taxes and fees. Includes superior voice quality and reliability with Ooma PureVoiceTM HD technology, voicemail, caller-ID, call-waiting and 911. Keep your current number for a one-time fee or choose a new number in any available area code for free. Optional advanced features are available with Ooma Premier service including unparalleled Blacklisting features to block telemarketers and other unwanted callers, free calling to Canada, an Instant Second Line, voicemail-to-email forwarding (audio file) and more. Ooma Telo also integrates with Amazon Echo, Nest devices, and numerous other smart products to give you convenience and peace of mind never before possible in a home phone.
feature_bullets: Crystal-clear nationwide calling for free and low International rates. Pay only monthly applicable taxes and fees.
# 1 rated home phone service for overall satisfaction and value by a leading consumer research publication.
Pure Voice HD delivers superior voice quality for a consistently great calling experience.
Includes nationwide calling, voicemail, caller-ID, call-waiting, 911 calling and text alerts.
More features including the ability to block robocallers available when you upgrade to Ooma Premier phone service.
Download the Ooma mobile app and take your Ooma service on-the-go.
Easy install in minutes; works with your high-speed internet and any home phone.

Ooma Telo also works with optional Ooma smart security sensors to monitor your home and contact you when activity is detected. Refer to the PDF attached below in technical specification for user manual.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars5,266 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
